Early version of the review drawer

I'm still not sure what to do with that, either we
use AOSP behavior and scroll the right to the gallery and
use the review drawer simply to quickly review burst shots for
instance, or we fully use the review drawer for all the shots.
It needs a lot of refinement on all sides, but I need a playground
to test how I could make a proper use of that.

I also prepared it for a 'Quick Review', like for examples
stacking shots from burst shot in a smaller version of the
review drawer, so user can see them directly and eventually tap
them right after being done with the burst.

There's some good ideas behind that, but I'll need some
experiment first.

Scale pictures for AutoPictureEnhances on some GPUs

GPUs that don't support non-Power-of-Two textures needs
to scale the image to the nearest power-of-two size, otherwise
GL is unhappy. It happens on Oppo Find 5 and Xperia Z (Vanilla
Adreno blobs).
However, non-PoT textures works fine on tegra3, exynos4
and nexus 4, so I'll leave the non-PoT support enabled for now.

When using PoT texture, big pictures have to be scaled down,
which can result in a little quality loss. However, since 13MP
pictures are just a little above 4096, it's almost imperceptible.
It takes a lot of ram however, hence why largeHeap has been
enabled (to avoid OutOfMemory error on Bitmap operations).
Don't autoenhance images when in softHDR or burst mode

Scale pictures for AutoEnhancer if texture size is > 4096

* Some devices support capturing pictures over 4096x4096 pixels,
but the GPU can't handle that.
14ac0c78df8ce914226ae91075299b19cd6bcf8b fixed that, but it scaled
all images to the nearest Power-of-Two to keep GL happy,
even if they were below 4096x4096 pixels.
* Fix that, and scale images only if they are > 4096x4096 pixels.

Change-Id: Idc410354cd87a12b5b5921d739b019912bed67be

add one-time camera check to disable Focal icon

Users of devices w/o cameras complain of the 'useless' Focal in the launcher.

By copying the DisableCameraReceiver from Gallery2 into Focal, it now does a one-time check for cameras on the device (nearly the
same behaviour as the camera portion of Gallery2 -- see below). If none are found, all Focal activites are disabled (hiding the icon
in the launcher).

Slight difference in the disable check compared to the Gallery2 camera check: Focal's check only hides the icon if there are NO
cameras found, where the Gallery2 camera icon will be hidden if there are no REAR cameras found.

Change-Id: I4cd6d475d5a1817d6e39826ab73b74a11cbff9f3

PicSphere: First batch of enhancements [1/2]

This patch:
- Update prebuilt assets - these are going to disappear soon. See the
second patch for details on the JNI part changes
- Add a libpopen_helper to let us run binaries through popen instead
of Java runtime class (which used to freeze randomly for no reason)
- Make use of pto_gen/cpfind in place of autopano, which is much better
and open up future enhancement possibilities (most noticeably, pre-
alignment of images so that it doesn't spend multiple minutes trying
to match each image separately, when we already know the relative
position of each shot).
- Make use of multiblend instead of enblend, which works similarly but
much faster (like, 172x faster)

PS2:
- Pre-align images using the gyroscope orientation to match only images
that are next to each other.
- Reformat shell command calls to be cleaner (using String.format)
- Use constants for settings

PS3:
- Cancel the addition of linefind
- Remove autopano
- Raise PicSphere default quality
- Don't lock 2:1 canvas on PicSphere render
- Support multiple PicSphere being rendered at once
- Fix percentage progress with new steps
- Use multiblend --wideblend option
- Various stability and bugfixes

Change-Id: I6efea4ce6c1a3d97f63ab687a3779b9ca358e2d5
Merge 'PicSphere: First batch of enhancements [1/2]' into cm-10.2

Focal: Fix all the crashes!

This patch enhances the overall stability, and fixes
a bunch of behavior bugs:
- Add a CameraApplication to safely close the camera HAL in case
of crash
- Fix crash when unbinding not bound software HDR service
- Fixed weird preview rotation sometimes
- Fixed wrong picture orientation on some devices
- Fixed Review Drawer deletion UX
- Fixed camera switching back when taking a picture
with the front camera
- Implement config_stopPreviewBetweenShots for real ; this
fixes total instability on older devices (like exynos4210)
- Enhance preview stop/start behavior
- Fix preview aspect ratio on some devices
- Fix burst shot getting stuck when taking two pictures in
one second. Image names now have milliseconds as well
- Fix review drawer obstructing viewfinder when taking burst
shot
- Fix shutter button dead on the very tap after taking a burst
- Fix long-pressing the shutter button causing crash when
switching mode

Change-Id: I1059016b22e4b2ef84a9ebbafc3ca44d5f964009

[WIP] Focal: Revamp the sidebar UI

This commit revamps the way the side bar
and widgets UI works. While keeping it
mostly similar to how it used to work, it has
been changed to better fit quick gestures.

The sidebar now have bigger icons and a short
text description beneath each item (Note to
translators: Some text might be too big, there
is a limit of 2 lines to keep it clean).
The widget panel also uses bigger icons and are
scrollable, with the description of each icon
scrolling in marquee. A widget can be dismissed
by swiping its 'title bar' to the right.
Widgets can also now be pinned to the main screen,
so that they are immediately accessible without
having to open the sidebar. Their toggle icon
then appears on the main screen instead of the
SideBar.

This also fixes the cling not showcasing the
views at the right place, and maybe one or two
other bugs.

This is still a work-in-progress and a few bugs
are to be expected (especially in landscape, I've
mostly tested it in portrait).

PicSphere: Hack the hack

cpfind uses ./ instead of the actual image path.
It causes a few troubles on devices not using multiuser,
or simply not having emulated storage. We just hardcode
/sdcard/ for now, and rely on the system backcompat.
This is highly ugly, but it's 2am and I just want this
fixed :)
